data.title: CONTENTdm
data.meta_description: Anne Weisse remembers serving as a Club Director for the U.S. Army Special Services unit, a recreation and entertainment-focused unit for enlisted men, during and immediately after World War II. Recalls the activities she designed and managed for troops including games, crafts, recreational trips and music. Remembers meeting celebrities including Pearl Bailey, Eddie Fisher, Mel Torme, the Inkspots, and Kay Medford. Details her time stationed in Germany and the many different dogs in her life. Describes trips to Paris and Rome, and recreational activities and nightlife in those cities. Recounts stories of interacting with locals in various foreign locations including France, Germany and Italy. Describes different assignments and postings in the United States including Fort Leavenworth, Kansas. Recalls the Depression and rationing goods, and Victory Gardens during the war. This interview is part of a collection of oral history interviews conducted by La Crosse Central High School students in 1995 for a social studies class taught by Mark Blackbourn. The UW-La Crosse Oral History Program, directed by Dr. Charles Lee, assisted the students in the process.
